## Overview

CHINET is a nationwide surveillance network monitoring bacterial resistance in China, coordinated by the Institute of Antibiotics at Huashan Hospital, Fudan University. Established in 1998, CHINET has become one of the longest-running and most comprehensive antimicrobial resistance surveillance systems in China.

## Key Features

- **Long-Term Data**: Over 25 years of continuous surveillance
- **Extensive Network**: Participation from major teaching hospitals across China
- **Bacterial Focus**: Emphasis on clinically significant bacterial pathogens
- **Annual Surveillance**: Regular monitoring and reporting
- **Quality Assurance**: Rigorous quality control measures
- **Academic Network**: Strong research and training components

## Use Cases in Research

- Long-term AMR trends in Chinese hospitals
- Regional variation in resistance patterns
- Emerging resistance mechanisms
- Impact of infection control measures
- Epidemiological studies of resistant pathogens
- Antimicrobial stewardship research

## Getting Started

Visit the [CHINET website](http://www.chinets.com/) to access surveillance data and learn about network participation.
